EXISTING STRUCTURES
────────────────────────
### Resource Depot & Smelting Facility at base position (x=-4.5, y=18.5)
Consists of:
• Wooden Chest at (x=-4.5, y=18.5) serving as central storage.
• Stone Furnace at (x=-3.0, y=19.0) for iron smelting.
• Stone Furnace at (x=-4.0, y=21.0) for copper plate production.
• Burner Inserter at (x=0.5, y=21.5) with drop position at (x=0.5, y=20.5).

### Automation Lab & Steam Power System (Integrated System)
Consists of:
• Lab at (x=-7.5, y=18.5) configured for automation research.
• Boiler at (x=-5.5, y=24.0) (flagged with fuel issues).
• Steam Engine (Generator) at (x=-0.5, y=24.5) with power network warnings.
• Offshore Pump at (x=-7.5, y=25.5) operating normally.
• Electricity Group with small electric poles at positions (x=-0.5, y=11.5), (x=-7.5, y=15.5), (x=-4.5, y=15.5), (x=3.5, y=19.5) and (x=1.5, y=22.5).
• Two PipeGroups forming the fluid network at (x=-10.5, y=16.5) & (x=-12.5, y=18.5) and at (x=-8.5, y=20.5) & (x=-2.5, y=21.5).

### Copper Cable Factory at position (x=1.5, y=19.5)
Consists of:
• Assembling Machine at (x=1.5, y=19.5) running the copper-cable recipe.
• Burner Inserter at (x=1.5, y=17.5).
• Input Chest at (x=2.5, y=17.5) for receiving copper plates.
• Output Chest at (x=1.5, y=21.5) for dispatching copper-cable.
• Dedicated Copper Buffer Chest at (x=-5.5, y=21.5) holding copper plates.
• Dedicated Transport Belt Segment at (x=0.5, y=17.5) connecting production outputs.
• Additional Burner Inserters at (x=2.5, y=16.5) and (x=3.5, y=17.5) with defined pickup and drop positions.

### Copper Extraction System (adjacent to the copper smelting furnace)
Consists of:
• Extraction Burner Inserter at (x=-3.5, y=23.5) with pickup at (x=-3.5, y=22.5) and drop at (x=-3.5, y=24.5).
• Copper Buffer Chest at (x=-3.5, y=26.5) for extraction storage.
• Chest Extraction Burner Inserter at (x=-3.5, y=27.5) with pickup at (x=-3.5, y=26.5) and drop at (x=-3.5, y=28.5).
• Belt Source Inserter with extraction drop at (x=-3.5, y=25.5).

### Extraction Belt Depot at position (x=3.5, y=15.5)
Consists of:
• Wooden Chest at (x=3.5, y=15.5) serving as the belt depot.
• Dedicated Transport Belt Segment at (x=4.5, y=15.5) for copper plate conveyance.
• Depot Burner Inserter at (x=3.5, y=14.5) with pickup at (x=3.5, y=15.5) and drop at (x=3.5, y=13.5).

### Belt Connection Target Setup for Copper Extraction
Consists of:
• Extraction Source: Wooden Chest at (x=3.5, y=15.5).
• Extraction Inserter: Located at (x=4.5, y=15.5) with pickup at (x=3.5, y=15.5) and drop at (x=5.5, y=15.5).
• Manual Transport Belt Chain connecting the extraction inserter drop to the target inserter pickup:
 – Horizontal segments: (7.5,15.5) – placed; (8.5,15.5) – placed; (6.5,15.5) – placement failed (entity already exists).
 – Vertical segments: (8.5,14.5), (8.5,13.5), (8.5,12.5) and (8.5,11.5) – placed; (8.5,10.5) – placement failed (entity already exists).
• New Target Inserter: Placed at (x=8.5, y=9.5) with pickup at (x=8.5, y=10.5) and drop at (x=8.5, y=8.5).
• Belt Chain Burner Inserter Refueling Subsystem:
 – Burner Inserter at (6.5,9.5): Refueled; inventory = Inventory({'coal': 10}).
 – Burner Inserter at (7.5,9.5): Refueled; inventory = Inventory({'coal': 10}).
 – Burner Inserter at (8.5,9.5): Refueled; inventory = Inventory({'coal': 10}).
 – Burner Inserter at (5.5,11.5): Refueled; inventory = Inventory({'coal': 10}).
 – Burner Inserter at (3.5,14.5): Still out of fuel (warning: [‘out of fuel’]).
 – Burner Inserter at (5.5,14.5): Still out of fuel (warning: [‘out of fuel’]).

(The structures remain unchanged as no new modifications were recorded in steps 352 to 359.)

ERROR TIPS
────────────────────────
• Transport Belt Placement on Occupied Tiles  
 – Ensure target positions are clear before placing transport belts to avoid collisions (e.g. failures at (6.5,15.5) and (8.5,10.5)).

• Fueling Burner Inserters and Inventory Management  
 – Verify that adequate coal is available before initiating refuel operations. “No coal to insert” errors require replenishing fuel supplies.

• Synchronized Refueling Verification  
 – Introduce sufficient wait times after refueling attempts to allow status updates on burner inserters.

• Variable Declaration in Extraction Routines  
 – Declare and initialize all positional and related variables in extraction procedures to prevent scope errors.

• Attribute Access in Component Inspection  
 – Validate object types and their properties prior to accessing attributes (e.g. ensuring a BeltGroup supports a ‘direction’ attribute).

• Inventory and Component Proximity Validation  
 – Confirm that all required components are present and correctly positioned before triggering sequential operations.

• Maintain Grid Alignment for Automated Connections  
 – Adhere to grid-based placements and ensure continuous connection paths to support reliable network connectivity.
